intro: Sebaea gariepina, commonly known as the Gariep sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. Sebaea gariepina is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
